data.title: Sylvia Anderson
data.meta_description: Sylvia Woodruff Anderson, 89, of Warren, Pa., died peacefully Wednesday evening, Dec. 8, 2021, with family at her side, at the Rouse Home, Youngsville, Pa.
data.text:
Sylvia was born July 13, 1932, in Warren, Pa. She was the daughter of Joseph and Ruth Dickinson Woodruff.

Sylvia was a lifelong Warren area resident. She was a 1949 graduate of Warren High School and earned her bachelorâ€™s degree in elementary education from Edinboro State College. She was employed as a school teacher with the Warren County School District, retiring in 1993, after a 21-year teaching career.

She was a member of Trinity Memorial Episcopal Church, the church altar guild, and a choir member. She also belonged to the Association of University Women, Warren Antique Study Club, Warren Garden Club, Circle 8 Square Dancing Group and the Warren Retired Teachers Association. She was an avid knitter, sewer, quilter and enjoyed reading.

Sylvia is survived by her four children: Gary Anderson, Ellen Scalise, Emily Cassidy and husband, James, Kristen Baughman and husband, Brian; one brother, David Woodruff of Euclid, Ohio; nine grandchildren; six great grandchildren; several nieces, nephews.

In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband, C. William Anderson, who died Feb, 11, 2013, whom she married Aug. 1, 1953, in Warren, Pa.

Friends may call at Trinity Memorial Episcopal Church Parlors, 444 Pennsylvania Ave. West, Warren, Pa., on Sunday, Dec. 19, 2021, from 1-2 p.m., when a memorial and committal service will be con-ducted with the Rev. Dr. Matthew R. Scott, vicar, officiating. Entombment will be in the church columbarium.

Those wishing to place memorials may do so through Hospice of Warren County, www.hospiceof warrencounty.org 1 Main Ave., Warren, PA 16365, and Struthers Library Theatre, strutherslibrarytheatre. com 302 W.3rd Ave., Warren, PA 16365.

E-mail condolences may be sent by visiting www.lewisfuneralhome inc.com

The Donald E. Lewis Funeral Home, Inc. has been entrusted with funeral arrangements.
